channel.title: AI & Telecom News Digest
channel.description: Daily AI & Telecom insights curated by n8n + Perplexity

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Telecom companies must adopt generative AI to reduce costs, drive growth, enhance security, and transform into technology-driven firms offering automated, AI-powered services.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: AWS chose 40 startups for its 2025 Generative AI Accelerator, providing up to $1 million in credits and expert support.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: By 2025, half of telecom companies have adopted generative AI, signaling significant integration of AI technologies in the telecommunications industry.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: The article highlights 150 AI use cases from startups, including Cursor, an AI-powered code editor featuring advanced generative AI and autonomous agents.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Deloitte Insights highlights telcos exploring opportunities to leverage generative AI as a key growth driver in the 2025 telecom industry landscape.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Singtel Enterprise aims to become an AI-first telco by advancing AI-driven network slicing, digital twins, and autonomous networks.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: EY warns the telecom sector faces increasing risks from AI challenges, ineffective digital transformation, and a complex geopolitical landscape.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: The European Commission will reveal its new strategy on October 8 to accelerate AI adoption across multiple European sectors.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: The Richmond Fed questions whether current AI investments mirror the 1990s telecom boom and bust, hinting at a potential AI bubble.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Generative AI, combined with AI-native platforms, zero trust, and quantum encryption, is driving the next growth wave in telecom enterprise security.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: PwC forecasts key AI trends and actionable strategies driving business transformation in 2025 and beyond.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: AT&T launched Geo Modeler, an advanced generative AI platform to enhance geographic data modeling in telecommunications.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: A global study of 100+ tier-1 telecom executives highlights the emerging opportunities and practical applications of generative AI in the telecom industry.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Malaysia launches Ryt Bank, its first AI-powered bank, while Google's Veo 3 AI video creation tools become widely available.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: NVIDIA's 2025 survey shows 84% of telecom companies are leveraging AI to drive industry growth and innovation.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: TelefÃ³nica highlights that major hyperscalers like AWS, Azure, and GCP are integrating generative AI, foundational models, and synthetic data to shape the future of public clouds.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: ZTE advances intelligent network solutions by integrating AI to enhance telecom infrastructure and services.
